faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: What is the difference between a certified and a sworn translation?
faq.a1: In many contexts, these terms are used interchangeably. It refers to a translation confirmed by a court-authorized translator, which is legally recognized by authorities.
faq.q2: How fast will I receive the translation?
faq.a2: Standard documents (e.g., birth certificates) are often processed within 24-48 hours. Postal delivery from Spain to Germany takes approx. 3-5 business days.
faq.q3: Do you need the original document?
faq.a3: In most cases, a high-quality scan is sufficient. The translation will state 'translated from scan'. Please check with your authority (accepted in 99% of cases).
faq.q4: Is the translation valid in Germany?
faq.a4: Yes. As a translator authorized by the OLG Cologne, my translations are recognized by all German authorities and courts.
faq.a5: You will receive an invoice including VAT. Payment is made conveniently via bank transfer.

aboutPage.title: María Ángeles Capas – Your Translator
aboutPage.introduction: As a dual-qualified translator, I bridge the legal systems of Spain and Germany. My authorization by the OLG Cologne and appointment by the Spanish Ministry guarantee you maximum legal certainty.
aboutPage.paragraph1: For many years, I have been supporting law firms, notaries, companies, and private individuals in overcoming language barriers in the bureaucratic jungle. I know that in legal texts, every detail counts.
aboutPage.paragraph2: In addition to my legal expertise, I also offer technical translations. Based in Spain with accreditation in Germany, I am the ideal link for your international affairs.
aboutPage.conclusion: Personal service, direct communication, and absolute confidentiality are a matter of course for me. I look forward to supporting you with your request.
